## Private Member Functions

### collectEquivalenceClasses() {#af8ab5911007fa9bfa8a5a4cab33ab396}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>EquivalenceClassMap Vectorizer::collectEquivalenceClasses (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> Begin, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> End)</>}>
Collects loads and stores grouped by &quot;equivalence class&quot;, where:

<ul>
<li>all elements in an eq class are a load or all are a store,</li>
<li>they all load/store the same element size (it&#39;s OK to have e.g. i8 and &lt;4 x i8&gt; in the same class, but not i32 and &lt;4 x i8&gt;), and</li>
<li>they all have the same value for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b1c5788b85ffa254be0e834edf5cf8f">getUnderlyingObject()</a>.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00337">337</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### gatherChains() {#ad16a1dc169f5a7edfcc54159ea79db81}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; Chain &gt; Vectorizer::gatherChains (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; Instrs)</>}>
Partitions Instrs into &quot;chains&quot; where every instruction has a known constant offset from the first instr in the chain.

Postcondition: For all i, ret&#91;i&#93;&#91;0&#93;.second == 0, because the first instr in the chain is the leader, and an instr touches distance 0 from itself.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00345">345</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getChainElemTy() {#aaad3d37d85a554352bac0a965a6270b9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type &#42; Vectorizer::getChainElemTy (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a> &amp; C)</>}>
Gets the element type of the vector that the chain will load or store.

This is nontrivial because the chain may contain elements of different types; e.g. it&#39;s legal to have a chain that contains both i32 and float.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00313">313</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isSafeToMove() {#af0c2e6c32b60d80acb3a91698e4981eb}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;bool IsLoadChain&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp&#125;::Vectorizer::isSafeToMove (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; ChainElem, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; ChainBegin, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &gt; &amp; ChainOffsets)</>}>
Determines whether <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem">ChainElem</a> can be moved up (if IsLoad) or down (if !IsLoad) to ChainBegin â€“ i.e.

there are no intervening may-alias instructions.

The map ChainElemOffsets must contain all of the elements in &#91;ChainBegin, <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/chainelem">ChainElem</a>&#93; and their offsets from some arbitrary base address. It&#39;s ok if it contains additional entries.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00323">323</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### mergeEquivalenceClasses() {#a2f036139bd7589dc314c910eb8f9ccac}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Vectorizer::mergeEquivalenceClasses (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#a88103682ba6de27fe6bf8d5915c3e210">EquivalenceClassMap</a> &amp; EQClasses) const</>}>
Merges the equivalence classes if they have underlying objects that differ by one level of indirection (i.e., one is a getelementptr and the other is the base pointer in that getelementptr).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00330">330</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.

### runOnChain() {#a48836ee09daa3ebaca10d64148776b08}

<MemberDefinition

Runs the vectorizer on one chain, i.e.

a subset of an equivalence class where all instructions access a known, constant offset from the first instruction.

### runOnEquivalenceClass() {#a2562e7a7070fa64c60dc0df83434c60f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Vectorizer::runOnEquivalenceClass (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#aaee92d4e61ec828be1e2db5a7f63f136">EqClassKey</a> &amp; EqClassKey, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; EqClass)</>}>
Runs the vectorizer on one equivalence class, i.e.

one set of loads/stores in the same BB with the same value for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b1c5788b85ffa254be0e834edf5cf8f">getUnderlyingObject()</a> etc.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00273">273</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### runOnPseudoBB() {#af85756be609cadfcf4cb5dd4fc3e6776}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Vectorizer::runOnPseudoBB (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> Begin, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> End)</>}>
Runs the vectorizer on a &quot;pseudo basic block&quot;, which is a range of instructions &#91;Begin, End) within one BB all of which have isGuaranteedToTransferExecutionToSuccessor(I) == true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00269">269</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.

### splitChainByAlignment() {#a3ad91de2dfd1aa6516c5b570ef3885e9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; Chain &gt; Vectorizer::splitChainByAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a> &amp; C)</>}>
Splits the chain into subchains that make legal, aligned accesses.

Discards any length-1 subchains.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00293">293</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.

### splitChainByContiguity() {#a5bba65a9f72ca8d5c3cb9650b787674d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; Chain &gt; Vectorizer::splitChainByContiguity (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a> &amp; C)</>}>
Splits the chain into subchains of instructions which read/write a contiguous block of memory.

Discards any length-1 subchains (because there&#39;s nothing to vectorize in there).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00284">284</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### splitChainByMayAliasInstrs() {#ab7852ee2c00ed3edbe297fb0817ad1f9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt; Chain &gt; Vectorizer::splitChainByMayAliasInstrs (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loadstorevectorizer-cpp-/#afd1adfcbfce320e6265935ce4d6299a3">Chain</a> &amp; C)</>}>
Splits the chain into subchains where it&#39;s safe to hoist loads up to the beginning of the sub-chain and it&#39;s safe to sink loads up to the end of the sub-chain.

Discards any length-1 subchains.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp/#l00289">289</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/vectorize/loadstorevectorizer-cpp">LoadStoreVectorizer.cpp</a>.

### vectorizeChain() {#a3ce4cc970bd1d4cc77962aa0e1d2ddd8}

<MemberDefinition

Converts the instrs in the chain into a single vectorized load or store.

Adds the old scalar loads/stores to ToErase.
